subject: Travel
title: The Colossus of Rhodes
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Colossus of Rhodes.

hook.text: A 108-foot bronze statue once greeted sailors entering the harbor of Rhodes.

buildup.text: It was built to celebrate a military victory and took twelve years to complete.

discovery.text: The statue depicted Helios, the sun god, and stood roughly as tall as the Statue of Liberty.

twist.text: An earthquake toppled it after just 56 years. Its ruins lay on the ground for eight centuries.

climax.text: Even fallen, it amazed visitors. Pliny wrote that few could wrap their arms around its thumb.

punchline.text: It fell in 56 years but inspired awe for 800.

quiz.question: Which god did the Colossus of Rhodes depict?
